definition: to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive

sentences.english: We are committed to help them do the latter.
sentences.chinese: 我們承諾將幫助他們化敵爲友。

sentences.english: I only honoured my promise to your father.
sentences.chinese: 我只不過完成了我對你父親的承諾。

sentences.english: It must not express that the drawee will perform his promise by any other means than the payment of money.
sentences.chinese: 不得書明付款人將用付款以外之方法履行承諾。

sentences.english: Consideration can be defined as mutual promises.
sentences.chinese: 雙價可定義爲相互的承諾。

sentences.english: It assures us a promising season of summer and also the most iportant havvest season-autum.
sentences.chinese: 它承諾我們夏天和最重要的收穫的季節秋天。

sentences.english: At the very least, that will make it hard for a future President to keep tax-cut promises.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎樣，下一任總統將很難兌現他們減稅的承諾。

sentences.english: Remember to carry out your promise.
Do not take that commitment for granted.
sentences.chinese: 不要把承諾當作是理所應當的。

sentences.english: The government has pledged itself to send aid to the famine victims.
The promise of fuel cells for efficient, eco-friendly power generation has become a reality.
sentences.chinese: 承諾燃料電池的效率高，環保型發電已成爲現實。
他做了一個虛情假意的承諾。

sentences.english: As can be seen from the cartoon, nowadays many people follow the hen and swarm into the tide of promise-making.
sentences.chinese: 從圖中看出，現如今很多人跟隨潮流，信奉承諾制。

sentences.english: That"Your requirement is our pursuing"is Zhongli is assiduity and promise.
sentences.chinese: “您的要求，是我們的追求”是公司的自勉和承諾。

sentences.english: Garfield denied he had promised anything to Conkling.
sentences.chinese: 加菲爾德否認他曾給康克林任何承諾。

sentences.english: The 54-year-old had promised during the campaign to serve out his term as mayor.
sentences.chinese: 當年54歲的朱立倫在競選中承諾將服滿市長任期。

sentences.english: The drivers in Gansu agreed to end their strike after the authorities promised to crack down on unlicensed taxis.
sentences.chinese: 甘肅司機同意，當局承諾打擊無照黑車後，結束罷工。

definition: plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
guarantee/to guarantee/to ensure/to safeguard/to pledge/CL:個|个[ge4]
(of a check etc) to cash/to honor a commitment
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
